* **Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams.** 
 You’ll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
* **An exceptional opportunity for growth.** 
 We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential—then, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you’ve got what it takes, you’ll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
* **Competitive pay and access to equity in the company.** 
 Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of £54,545 in the UK and €52,246 elsewhere. If they possess a few years of relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between £66,779 and £149,636 in the UK, and €63,965 and €143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
* **All. These. Benefits.** 
 Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.


**Commitment & contract**
 Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time.
   

  

**Location**
 Milan (Italy), London (UK) or remote.
   

  

**Before you apply**
 Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We’re extremely ambitious and we hold ourselves—and one another—to a high standard. While this tends to lead to extraordinary learning, achievement, and career growth, it also requires significant commitment.
   

  

 To help you ramp up quickly and set yourself up for success, we recommend spending your first few months working from our Milan office, regardless of your long-term work location. It’s the best way to rapidly absorb our company culture and build trust with your new teammates. We’ll fully support you with generous travel and accommodation assistance.
   

  

 After that, you’re welcome to work from our offices in Milan or London, or remotely from approved countries—depending on what we agree at the offer stage.
   

  

 If the role speaks to you and you’re excited to give your best, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now—we can’t wait to meet you.
   

  

**The selection process**
 If you pass our screening, we’ll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you’re successful with those, we’ll invite you to a series of interviews.
   

  

 Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested through this form.
   

  

 Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn’t a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

title: Product Designer - Creator Studio
description:
****Job Description****
 Do you thrive in a complex and fast-moving environment? Are you excited by the opportunity to shape a growing brand and business? We’re looking for a designer to join the assortment team at Creator Studio during a temporary assignment.
   

  

 Creator Studio is part of New Growth and Ventures – H&M Group’s unit for exploring and scaling new sustainable business models and partnerships. We're a digital-first, on-demand platform built to transform the world of branded merchandise—empowering creators (artists, influencers & brands) everywhere to design, launch, and grow their own merch lines with ease. Our goal is simple: to make merch smarter, more sustainable, and more creative—for everyone.
   

  

 True Blanks is our signature brand—designed for creators in our Creator Studio offering and offered wholesale to distributors and embellishment partners. Our mission is to deliver a carefully curated, fashion-forward range that stays ahead of trends, reduces overstock, and maximizes impact. Each piece is made with sustainable materials, optimized for print-on-demand, and thoughtfully priced. True Blanks isn’t just apparel—it’s a new standard in quality, responsibility, and modern design, crafted with purpose and attention to every detail.
   

  

****Job Description****
 Are you a creative and curious designer with a passion for product development, print techniques and innovation? Do you enjoy building new things from scratch, working cross-functionally and seeing your designs come to life? Are you an entrepreneurial spirit? Join our assortment team during this exciting phase of growth and development.
   

  

 This is a temporary position for approximately 12-14 months to support our design and assortment development. The role fills a critical need during a period of strategic expansion.
   

  

**Your responsibilities:**
* Create trend reports, color and mood boards, and visual concepts
* Stay up to date with fashion trends, customer behaviors, and technical developments in fabrics and print
* Translate brand and customer needs into strong, sustainable, and commercially viable designs
* Design and develop True Blanks products for men, women, and kids—tailored for exceptional printability and creator customization
* Own the full design process – from sketch to final sample – including design packs and handovers
* Collaborate with product manager, production, logistics, tech and external suppliers
* Work closely with external print partners to ensure high-quality results across various techniques, materials, and applications
* Contribute to assortment strategy and product direction through creative insight, customer understanding, and data analysis
* Support the curation and selection of third-party products, helping build a well-rounded and inspiring platform offer


****Qualifications****
* Strong experience in fashion design with a deep understanding of print techniques and production
* Excellent eye for color, shape, material and detail
* Solid knowledge of how different fabrics affect print quality and outcome
* Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop), and working knowledge of CLO 3D
* A structured and self-sufficient way of working, with a flexible and agile mindset
* Curious, solution-oriented and proactive – thrives in a startup-like environment
* Business-minded with strong communication and collaboration skills
* Fluent in English (spoken and written)


****Additional Information****
 This is a temporary full-time role based at our office on Drottninggatan 57 in Stockholm, starting ideally in September/October. The role supports a strategic expansion of our product offering, with a focus on both the Creator platform and wholesale development.
   

  

 Please submit your CV (no cover letter required) and notify your manager before applying internally.
   

  

****WHO WE ARE****
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

 All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

 This is a full-time position is based in Stockholm. You will report to the department Assortment Designer
   

  

 If your experience, skills, and ambitions are right for this role, please send your application including CV and relevant portfolio work (pdf max 10mb/uploading). All documents should be in English.
   

  

 For internal candidates: please remember to always speak with your current manager when applying for an internal role. Please know that if you are currently permanently employed, you will keep this base employment status while taking on a temporary role.
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.


 The journey starts here
   

  

 H&M Incentive Program - H&M Group

title: Product Analyst
description:
**In this role you will have the opportunity to drive and develop product analytics in the consumer domain, an area that evolves around the search experience on hemnet.se and in our apps. You will play an important role in the cross functional team that aims to develop and improve our products with a well-proven data and insight driven work method. It is all about understanding user behavior by gathering, interpreting and visualizing data to get powerful insights.
   

  

 🛑 Last application day August 4th** 
  

  

**What You’ll Do** 
  

  

 As a Product Analyst at Hemnet, you’ll turn data into actionable insights that drive smarter decisions and shape the future of our product. You’ll be a key part of a cross-functional product team, bringing data into the heart of decision-making to improve user experiences and deepen our understanding of user behavior.
   

  

 You’ll also be part of Hemnet’s Analytics team, working with other analysts and BI developers to support the entire organization with insights that help us reach our business goals. Together, you’ll contribute to the evolution of our analytics function and drive Hemnet in making faster and better decisions.
   

  

 In this role, we place a strong emphasis on communication—you’re not just supporting product development, you’re actively driving it forward through insight and collaboration.
   

  

**You’ll get to:** 
  

  

* Drive the analytics work in the Consumer domain and act as a strategic partner on everything from prioritizations to hypothesis testing and insight-driven product development
* Analyze user behavior and trends to uncover opportunities and inform product improvements
* Build dashboards and reports that provide clear, actionable insights to your team
* Design, run and evaluate A/B tests and other experiments to optimize the user experience
* Be part of the broader Analytics team at Hemnet – collaborating with other product analysts and BI developers to strengthen how we work with data and insight across the whole company


  

  

**What We Think You Bring** 
  

  

 We’re looking for someone who can clearly communicate complex analyses to a wide range of stakeholders. Your ability to tailor messages, build trust, and turn data into action will be key to shaping product strategy and elevating the user experience.
   

  

* Extensive experience as a product analyst, preferably in a tech environment, agile team, or data-driven company
* Strong communication skills – you know how to turn data into clear insights and guide others to act on them
* Solid skills in working with raw data and writing SQL queries
* Experience using tools like Google BigQuery, Amplitude, Google Analytics, GTM, Looker Studio or or other similar analytics tools
* Experience with experimentation, conversion optimization, and A/B testing
* A curious and solution-oriented mindset – you enjoy finding new ways forward and challenging the status quo
* For this role, we are looking for someone who has a professional proficiency in both Swedish and English


  

  

****🏡** 
 Your career at Hemnet** 
  

  

 Are you ready to play a meaningful role in one of the biggest decisions people make in life? If so – welcome to Hemnet! Since 1998, we’ve taken pride in making the life-changing, often stressful journey of finding a new home as smooth and enjoyable as possible.
   

  

 At Hemnet, our mission is to connect every seller with every buyer, empower buyers to discover every home for sale, and enable real estate agents to match seamlessly with sellers. With over 40 million monthly visits, we’re Sweden’s most popular property platform and the first choice for Swedes looking to buy or sell a home. Together, we’re creating an open, transparent housing market, making home transactions in Sweden among the most efficient in the world.
   

  

 Our success is built on a strong, friendly culture that values creativity, inclusivity, and collaboration. Hemnet is a place where everyone has a voice, and our welcoming environment helps you thrive and grow as you work alongside passionate colleagues from around the globe.
   

  

**A Hybrid Way of Working** 
  

  

 Our vibrant office in central Stockholm is the hub of our collaboration and culture, providing a lively space that fosters team spirit. We come together in the office three days a week, with two flexible remote days. To be part of our team, it’s essential to be based in or near Stockholm.

title: Graphic Designer
description:
*# WELCOME TO ONECRUITER!: Onecruiter is unique in many ways - we hope you will notice that as soon as you walk in the door. We are creating the future for recruitment and employer branding and hope you will like to join in and make an impact. In the office, we kick off our shoes because we want it to feel like home. We are a non-prestige team that competes with big international players and that makes high demands - which we love. Put on your socks and join in!*
 At
 **Grade** 
 , we're building better workplaces by helping people find the right jobs and helping companies hire and grow smarter. As a fast-growing HR tech company with deep roots across the Nordics, we’re on a mission to build a strong, unified brand—and we’re looking for a
 *creative powerhouse* 
 to lead that charge.
   

  

 We’re not looking for someone to just “make things pretty.” We need a strategic design partner—someone with vision, craft, and the ambition to push boundaries.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As our sole in-house visual designer, you will:
   

  

* Own, evolve, and enforce the visual identity of all Grade brands, balancing creativity with consistency.
* Be the brand champion—ensuring every design aligns with our guidelines and upholds a coherent, recognizable look and feel across channels.
* Design a wide variety of materials, including:
+ Social media assets, digital ads, and web visuals
+ Sales decks, pitch presentations, and internal communications
+ Event materials, trade show booths, and employer branding
+ Campaigns and marketing collateral
+ Web design (WordPress & Elementor)

* Collaborate closely with marketing managers to turn ideas and strategies into compelling visual assets.
* Bring a critical eye to the table—don’t just follow briefs; refine, challenge, and elevate them.
* Act as “brand police” when needed—confidently guiding others toward design consistency and brand integrity.
* Leverage AI-powered tools to boost efficiency, experiment, and scale creative output.


**What We’re Looking For**
* 5+ years of experience and a strong portfolio of branding and marketing design.
* A hybrid mindset—you value classic design principles but embrace new formats, tools, and platforms.
* Proficiency with Figma, Canva, WordPress (Elementor), Adobe Creative Suite, and comfort with both digital and print.
* Fluency in AI-based design tools (image/video generation) and the ability to prompt effectively in line with our brand voice.
* Ability to juggle multiple projects with speed and precision—no bottlenecks here.


 Grade is undergoing an exciting transformation—from a house of brands to a cohesive
 **master brand** 
 . You’ll be the creative lead behind that evolution. This is your chance to
 **build a recognizable, standout visual identity** 
 that ties everything together.
   

  

**You’ll love this role if you...**
* Want end-to-end creative ownership
* Crave variety and impact
* Believe in brand as a business driver
* Think design is about strategy as much as aesthetics


**Why join Grade?**
 We’re a fast-growing group of companies under the Grade brand, backed by Viking Growth. With 200+ employees across the Nordics, we offer a full suite of talent solutions - from recruitment to development.
   

  

 At Grade, you’ll find a warm, inclusive culture with high ambitions and a strong team spirit. We value your growth, well-being, and work-life balance.
   

  

**What we offer** 
 (note this might change depending on the country)
   

  

* Flexible hours & remote work options
* 6 weeks' vacation
* Wellness allowance (SEK 5,000/year + 1 hour/week for exercise)
* ITP1 pension, salary exchange, and parental pay
* Great onboarding and career development opportunities


**How We Hire**
 No cover letter needed - just your CV and answers to a few short questions. We review applications continuously, so don’t wait to apply!
   

  

**Location:** 
 Hybrid - Stockholm, Trollhättan, Lund, Helsinki, Oulu, Oslo or Bodo.

title: Product Lead, Conversational AI
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 We are looking for an experienced Product Lead to join the
 **Conversational AI Team** 
 within the support product group.
 **The** 
**Support Group** 
 consists of
 **5** 
 different teams building products and tools that power Wolt’s customer support.
   

  

 Delightful customer experience is one of the cornerstones of Wolt, and we see Wolt’s high quality support as an important part of the overall customer experience. Over the years, we have invested a lot in our in-house built support tooling and products, as we believe it’s the best way for us to provide a world-class support experience and ensure satisfaction for our consumers, courier partners, and merchants across the 30 countries we operate in.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll be leading Wolt’s strategic efforts in exploring AI opportunities in the support domain. As Product Lead, you will own the vision and roadmap for a team within the support group. This involves leading multiple projects and cross-team product initiatives across the entire product lifecycle, partnering with business and operations stakeholders as well as understanding our end-users better than anyone. You’ll build an in-depth understanding of Wolt’s support operations and our users, including consumers, merchants, courier partners, and our internal support operations teams. You will work with a cross-functional team of incredibly talented engineers, designers, and data experts in a high-visibility role.
   

  

**Our humble expectations**
 You could come to this role from a multitude of different backgrounds, but ideally, you have
   

  

* Proven experience as a Product Lead / Product Manager, preferably with experience from the consumer and/or AI space - you know what it takes to develop great consumer products
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and have proven ability to influence cross-functional teams and senior stakeholders/executives.
* Desire to be in a high-ownership, high-visibility role. You need to be comfortable with both driving the strategic vision for the domain but also getting hands-on and diving into the details.
* A mixture of data analysis skills, engineering understanding and business savvy with the go-getter attitude of a "could-be start-up CEO"
* Expertise in how to work with and lead cross-functional teams, at least with developers, design, data experts and with engineering teams


**Next steps**
 The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!
   

  

 The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Product Lead, Live - Contraband
description:
Contraband, our upcoming AAA co-op open world action game and new IP published by Microsoft Xbox Game Studios, is now looking for a Product Lead to join the team!
   

  

**The Position**
 As the Product Lead for Live, you are responsible for the player acquisition, engagement, retention and monetization strategy of our Live service. You will own the product vision for Live, optimize player value for our Live KPIs, manage a small team of Product Managers, and lead Marketing, Community and Analytics for the project.
   

  

 You will also be a key stakeholder of the Development team on new Live game features, content, and platform capabilities, and represent Live towards our publisher. Your primary focus will be on prioritizing the development roadmap and ensuring all releases meet their targets.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Define and drive the product strategy for the Live service.
* Optimize player value to improve acquisition, engagement, retention and monetization KPIs.
* Identifying opportunities through live data, community playtests, market research and player insights
* Define and realise a high-fidelity Live plan for the next 6 months. Manage the Live features backlog
* Hire, manage and mentor a team of Product Managers.
* Lead collaboration with the Marketing and Community teams; serve as the main client for Data Science.
* Act as a major stakeholder of the Development team to help define new Live game features, content, and platform capabilities.
* Provide regular Live performance updates and recommendations to the game leadership.
* Represent the Live service towards Microsoft.


**Who You Are**
* A strategic product leader with a deep understanding of gamers’ desires and preferences, and a keen eye for market trends.
* Experienced in overseeing the entire lifecycle of a Live service, from conception to release and live operation, with a focus on continuous updates, expansions, and events.
* Ideally on 1 Live AAA title or more, with a large publisher.
* Adept at bridging creative vision with business objectives to deliver unrivaled player experiences while meeting financial goals.
* Skilled in navigating the evolving landscape of gaming platforms, player communities, and emerging technologies.
* Proven ability to lead a team and to collaborate effectively with Development, Marketing, Community, and Analytics.
* Proficient in data-informed decision-making, utilizing analytics, player insights, and market research.
* Knowledgeable about personalization and player-centric approaches to deliver tailored gameplay and customized content.


*Note: Research shows under-represented groups in the industry (especially women) might not apply to a job if they don’t check off every requirement. At Avalanche, we’re more about your drive to learn and interest in tackling challenges than what’s on your resume! So don’t stress if you don’t tick every box— shoot us your application anyway! Diverse opinions and different experiences are what make our teams so great, not itemized lists of qualifications.*
**The Stockholm location**
 Our Stockholm office is situated in Södermalm, the beating heart of the city’s game industry. It’s a physical representation of our games – the lush vegetation of Just Cause and theHunter: Call of the Wild meets corroded metal straight out of Mad Max. It has everything you need to make it your creative base camp.
   

  

**Our values**
 At Avalanche Studios Group, we create worlds beyond limits. But that’s not exclusive to our games, so we’re committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workplace. All Avalanchers have a shared responsibility to create an open work environment where everyone is treated equally and respectfully. Being part of our world is not contingent on your heritage, your gender, or sexual orientation. It’s all about your passion and creativity.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 To apply for this position, please register below and provide your CV in English. We review applications continuously. All further studio-related information is provided under a non-disclosure agreement.
   

  

*At Avalanche Studios Group we're always on the lookout for talented individuals to join our passionate team, but please note that relocation assistance is not available for this role.*

title: Product Lead, Autonomous Deliveries
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 We are looking for a Product Lead to join the
 **Autonomous Deliveries** 
 Team,
 **Courier** 
 group. The Courier group at Wolt operates with the mission of providing a high-quality delivery experience for our Consumers, becoming the most-loved platform for Couriers, and being the most efficient logistics engine in the industry.
   

  

 Autonomous deliveries is a new team within the Courier group that is focused on revolutionizing logistics by integrating autonomous vehicles, such as drones and robots, into Wolt’s delivery operations. Logistics is at the heart of Wolt’s business, and mastering it can mean the difference between creating seamless, delightful customer experiences and dealing with operational chaos.
   

  

 The Product Lead for Autonomous Deliveries will drive the vision and execution of building scalable and end-end autonomous delivery experiences for our consumers, working cross-functionally across Consumer, Merchant, and Support product teams at Wolt, as well as leading critical integration discussions with Wolt’s autonomous delivery partners. This high-visibility role shapes the future of delivery, transforming each delivery into an opportunity to build delight and loyalty.
   

  

 As a Product Lead, you will work with a cross-functional team of incredibly talented engineers, designers, product people, and analysts in a high-visibility role. You will be responsible for defining the roadmap and setting the vision for your team. This involves leading multiple projects and cross-team product initiatives across the entire product lifecycle, partnering with business and operations stakeholders, and understanding our end-users better than anyone.
   

  

**Our humble expectations**
 You could come to this role from a multitude of different backgrounds, but ideally, you have
   

  

* Plenty of experience as a Product Manager/Lead, preferably in e-commerce or on-demand delivery. Experience within the autonomous delivery space would be a plus.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and have proven ability to influence cross-functional teams
* A mixture of data analysis skills, engineering understanding, and business savvy with the go-getter attitude of a "could-be start-up CEO"
* Expertise in how to work with and coach cross-functional teams, at least with developers, finance, data experts and engineering teams


**Next steps**
 The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!
   

  

 The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Business Systems Analyst, Learning Management
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 We are looking for a Business Systems Analyst, Learning Management who will help build and maintain our new LMS and L&D tech ecosystem in order to execute our learning strategy in a fast-paced environment. This role will drive continuous improvement opportunities in order to optimize & enhance agent learning programs, to ultimately ensure our global network of thousands of support agents are set up to successfully deliver on support experiences.
   

  

 What you’ll be doing
   

  

* Help oversee the Lead day-to-day operations and maintenance of the LMS (Cornerstone), including assigning and monitoring security permissions for LMS Administrators, and resolving trouble tickets. by collaborating with a team of learning and development professionals.
* Collaborate with a team of passionate LMS Administrators who are focused on executing daily deployment, reporting, and user maintenance responsibilities.
* Develop and maintain standardized documentation and SLAs on LMS operational processes and procedures to ensure a comprehensive LMS governance model.
* Communicate to stakeholders the status and project progress of all work related to training content management.
* Deliver functional and technical support for other LMS users and content creators. Utilize data to make informed recommendations on enhancements, while also providing analysis and reporting to stakeholders on learner performance and training effectiveness.
* Perform user-acceptance testing within LMS when new programs are developed. Create job aids and other support documents to support launch of new programs..
* Make recommendations for future improvements to content management, workflow processes, and user experience.


 Our humble expectations
   

  

* You are passionate about learning software and administration
* You have 4+ years experience in Cornerstone LMS administration that includes creating learning paths, certifications and badging programs, ideally with multiple LMS systems
* You have 3+ years experience leading highly creative learning teams
* You are collaborative and know how to develop strong productive relationships both internally and with our external partners
* You know how to present complex information in a clear and concise manner with strong written, verbal, and visual communication skills
* You are highly analytical and data driven in your decision making process. You are comfortable pulling data from various sources, reading and analyzing data, doing analysis in excel or google sheets, and partnering with analytics partners for more complex analyses
* You are comfortable in a fast-paced, constantly changing team-oriented environment and able to manage multiple deadlines simultaneously with strong project management skills
* You have an owner mentality: you're focused on quality, output driven, proactive, and always pushing yourself to do better
* You can think strategically and recommend solutions to complex problems while also executing many projects and priorities day-to-day
* Experience working with Salesforce, Asana, Lessonly, Articulate, Tableau
* You question the why behind your objectives, and surface areas of strategic misalignment
* You own a project / within your team; you set strategy and build an execution plan to achieve your objective with minimal oversight / guidance from your Manager
* You find the right balance of data and common sense to problem solve, and think creatively when we have incomplete information


**Next steps**
 If you are excited about working in a high-growth environment, taking ownership, and being part of an extremely ambitious team, then click below to apply and get the conversation going!
   

  

 We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis, so if this sounds like an opportunity you want to pursue, apply today!
   

  

 Please note that we do not accept applications coming in via email. Please submit your application in English via our job portal.
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Product Lead, Courier Acquisition & Onboarding
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 We are looking for a Product Lead to join the Courier Acquisition & Onboarding team within the Courier product group. This team sits at the heart of Wolt’s growth. Our job is to ensure that anyone who wants to become a courier partner can discover Wolt, apply with ease, and get on the road quickly, confidently, and compliantly. We own the full funnel: from first touchpoint to activation, and everything in between. We obsess over removing friction, personalizing journeys for different markets, and building an onboarding experience that’s not only fast and efficient but also welcoming and supportive because the start of a courier’s journey defines the quality of our service for everyone.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll lead Wolt’s courier acquisition funnel from awareness to onboarding and activation. You’ll own the product vision and roadmap, identifying and addressing funnel bottlenecks through data, experimentation, and rapid iteration.
   

  

 Working cross-functionally with marketing, operations, engineering, design, and data, you’ll build seamless, scalable onboarding experiences. You’ll deeply understand courier needs and champion their journey, ensuring every step, from discovery to activation, is optimized and delightful.
   

  

**Our humble expectations**
 You could come to this role from a multitude of different backgrounds, but ideally, you have
   

  

* You have 5+ years of experience in product management, growth, or marketing roles, with a strong track record managing user or merchant acquisition funnels, onboarding flows, or conversion journeys. Experience in logistics, gig economy, or three-sided marketplaces is a plus, but not required.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a proven ability to influence cross-functional teams and senior stakeholders. You communicate clearly, bring stakeholders together, and drive alignment in fast-moving, multicultural environments.
* Desire to be in a high-ownership, high-visibility role. You're comfortable driving the strategic vision while also getting hands-on, solving complex problems, and navigating ambiguity with a builder’s mindset.
* A mixture of data analysis skills, engineering understanding, and business savvy — paired with the go-getter attitude of a “could-be startup CEO.” You’re confident digging into data, defining metrics, building dashboards, and running A/B tests — always balancing evidence with intuition.
* Expertise in leading cross-functional teams, including developers, designers, and data experts. You’re passionate about great UX and know how to collaborate with designers to ship beautiful, intuitive products.


**Next steps**
 The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!
   

  

 The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.

That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Tink - Engineering Manager - Customer Experience
description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
   

  





 Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

  

  





**Visa’s Technology Organization** 
 is a community of problem solvers and innovators reshaping the future of commerce. We operate the world’s most sophisticated processing networks capable of handling more than 65k secure transactions a second across 80M merchants, 15k Financial Institutions, and billions of everyday people. While working with us you’ll get to work on complex distributed systems and solve massive scale problems centered on new payment flows, business and data solutions, cyber security, and B2C platforms.
   

  





 We are seeking a Engineering Manager to Tink - delivering open banking solutions as a part of Visa, to the Customer Experience team. The Customer Experience team has a clear mission: to deliver world-class product experiences to its customers. We provide powerful solutions to developers and their consumers. By solving the right problem, crafting a scalable solution, and providing great experiences, we make the platform easy to use, quick to onboard, and we ensure reliable outcomes for the end-user. That is why front-end development and UX design are core to us at Customer Experience. The Customer Experience area is unique with its set up of front-end and full-stack teams. With this, you will have the opportunity to not only develop the people and products we own but also how Tink as a whole work with frontend development and UX. We believe that there are a lot of things to be done and an opportunity for someone to grow within their role.
   

  





**What you will do:**




 Even though we have a broad mandate, there are some parts of the Tink experience we are especially passionate about. See more of the work we do and a few use cases here.
   

  





 We use React, TypeScript, Golang, MySQL, node.js and all our microservices run on Kubernetes in AWS. We regularly deploy to production and assure quality by automated tests and monitoring. The team is responsible for the availability of the services it owns, has SLOs/SLIs in place as well as an on-call rotation.
   

  





**Responsibilities**



* Drive technical development and provide leadership in an innovative and fast-paced environment


* Build high performing teams to support a cross-functional team composed of backend and frontend engineers


* Work closely with product manager and designers to ensure we're building products in the best way


* Enable the team to reach their targets by removing impediments, clarifying goals and initiatives, and fostering ownership and accountability


* Facilitate a culture of learning, trust, responsibility, and friendliness


* Be responsible for the overall planning, execution and deliver on agreed timelines


* Make sure the team has the talent it needs to succeed long-term by hiring great people



 We strongly believe in the power of collaboration, both within our team and in partnership with other teams and stakeholders. Working together is the cornerstone of building exceptional teams, delivering outstanding products, and fostering personal growth. It forms the very essence of our work culture and defines how we operate.
   

  





 This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your Hiring Manager.
   

  





  

  

  

  




**Qualifications**

 Basic Qualifications
   

  

 5+ years of relevant work experience and a Bachelors degree, OR 8+ years of relevant work experience
   

  

  

  

 Preferred Qualifications
   

  

 5+ years of relevant work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or at least 2 years of work experience with an Advanced degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or 0 years of work experience with a PhD, OR 8+ years of relevant work experience.
   

  

  

  

 We are looking for an Engineering Manager who has a business-oriented mindset, understands how projects and delivery influences business growth and sees the link between engineering and product development. Someone who is great at managing change and changing priorities.
   

  




* Experience from an Engineering Manager position, leading a cross-functional engineering team.
* Experience from frontend and backend engineering
* A track record of operational excellence and have led a change initiative, for example taking a project or team from A to B.
* Solid experience from working in an agile development environment, preferably from a fintech/payments industry.
* Strong organizational and prioritization skills along with outstanding written and verbal communication skills.
* We are looking for an Engineering Manager who has a business-oriented mindset, understands how projects and delivery influences business growth and sees the link between engineering and product development. Someone who is great at managing change and changing priorities.


**Additional Information**

 Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: Senior Product Owner – Agilt Infrastrukturteam (Databas)
description:
Vi söker erfarna fullstackutvecklare för att förstärka vårt utvecklingsteam. Konsulterna kommer att spela en viktig roll i att vidareutveckla och förvalta e-tjänster för myndigheten, särskilt inom frontendutveckling, i nära samarbete med UX-specialister och produktägare.
   

  

 Uppdraget kan innebära att du arbetar med att analysera krav, skapa lösningsförslag, nyutveckla samt vidareutveckla befintliga tjänster och funktioner. Du kommer att arbeta med testdriven utveckling (TDD) och testautomatisering som en naturlig del av ditt arbete, samtidigt som du säkerställer dokumentation av arbetet och samarbetar effektivt i teamet för att leverera enligt uppsatta mål.
   

  

 Konsulterna kommer att bidra med expertkompetens och kan även komma att involveras i andra projekt och förvaltning inom systemutveckling.
   

  

**Ska-krav**
* Kompetensnivå 3 (4-8 års erfarenhet inom relevant område).
* Minst tre (3) års erfarenhet som fullstackutvecklare, där frontendutveckling (grafiska användargränssnitt) har varit en central del. Erfarenhet av Java och Vue.js är ett krav.
* Minst ett (1) års erfarenhet av att arbeta med REST-baserade tjänster.
* Minst tre (3) års erfarenhet av testdriven utveckling och testautomatisering som en naturlig del av arbetet.
* Erfarenhet av arbete i agila team och enligt agila arbetssätt (Scrum, Kanban eller liknande).
* Relevant universitets- eller högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Mycket god kommunikationsförmåga i svenska, både muntligt och skriftligt.


**Bör-krav**
* Erfarenhet av Quarkus.
* Erfarenhet av utveckling i Linux-miljö.
* Erfarenhet av kravanalys och att i samarbete med beställare skapa lösningar och prototyper.
* Erfarenhet av utvecklingsverktyget IntelliJ.
* Erfarenhet av containerbaserade teknologier som Docker, Kubernetes och OpenShift.
* Erfarenhet av arbete med öppen källkod.


**Stationeringsort**
* Stockholm eller Kalmar. Möjlighet till distansarbete finns, men det beslutas i samråd med uppdragsgivaren och baseras på projektbehovet.


**Tidsram**
* Uppdraget startar den 19 maj 2025 och löper fram till den 18 maj 2026, med möjlighet till förlängning på 6+6 månader.


**Omfattning**
* 100% av en heltid.


 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan och hoppas att du vill vara med och bidra till vår fortsatta framgång!
   

  

**Om Rasulson Consulting**
 Rasulson Consulting är ett specialiserat bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag inom IT-sektorn. Vi samarbetar med ledande tech-bolag och innovativa startupföretag för att erbjuda spännande karriärmöjligheter för dig med intresse för digital utveckling. Genom vår djupa tekniska förståelse och vårt starka nätverk kan vi snabbt matcha rätt kompetenser med rätt uppdrag. Hos oss får du personlig vägledning, regelbunden återkoppling och möjligheten att ta nästa steg i din IT-karriär.

title: IT- och Administrativ Supportspecialist
description:
**Om arbetsplatsen:**  

Centuria Skola är en 7–9-skola i Västerås som till hösten flyttar till helt nya, moderna lokaler på Finnslätten. Vi arbetar med tydlig struktur, ordning och reda och har höga förväntningar på både elever och personal. Hos oss är trygghet, studiero och kunskapsfokus i centrum – i en miljö där eleverna får utvecklas både socialt och kunskapsmässigt.
  
  

**Arbetsuppgifter:****Teknisk support & IT-drift:**  

Uppdatering, drift och vidareutveckling av hemsidor
  
Felsökning och administrering av datorer (PC, Mac, Chromebooks, iPads)
  
Installation och hantering av mjukvara, licenser och konton
  
Skapa och hantera inloggningar för elever och personal
  
Stöd för digitala prov (Skolverket) och andra webbaserade verktyg
  
Övervakning av datasäkerhet och säkerhetsrutiner (GDPR)
  
Hantera och underhålla interna IT-system och nätverk
  
Arbeta nära pedagoger och ledning för att lösa tekniska behov
  
  

**Administrativa uppgifter:**  

Bistå i administration kopplad till elevantagning, schemaläggning och registrering
  
Samla in, hantera och analysera data för beslutsstöd (t.ex. Excel, Google Sheets)
  
Dokumenthantering, mötesprotokoll, kommunikation och arkivering
  
Stöd i planering och uppföljning av projekt och interna processer
  
Samordning mellan olika avdelningar och externa kontakter
  
Hjälpa till med övriga administrativa uppgifter i den dagliga verksamheten
  
  

**Flexibla uppgifter:**  

Vikariera vid behov i klassrummet (undervisning utifrån lärarens planering)
  
Utföra enklare praktiska och tekniska arbetsuppgifter i lokalerna
  
Vara behjälplig vid events, tekniska uppställningar och interna möten
  
  

**Kvalifikationer:**  

Förmåga att snabbt lära dig nya system och rutiner
  
Erfarenhet av arbete i Google Workspace och andra kontorssystem
  
God förmåga att hantera och presentera data samt arbeta strukturerat
  
Vana av att arbeta serviceinriktat, både med teknik och administration
  
Starka problemlösningsfärdigheter och god analytisk förmåga
  
Mycket god samarbetsförmåga och kommunikationsstil
  
Goda kunskaper i engelska, både i tal och skrift
  
Flexibel och lösningsfokuserad med vilja att bidra där det behövs
  
  

**Meriterande:**  

Tidigare erfarenhet av IT-support och administrativt arbete i skola eller liknande verksamhet
  
Kunskap inom datasäkerhet, licenshantering och digitala utbildningsverktyg
  
Erfarenhet av schemaläggning, elevregistersystem, och dokumentation
  
  

**Kvalifikationer:**  

Vi söker en driven och mångsidig medarbetare som vill arbeta i en kombinerad roll med både IT- och administrativa arbetsuppgifter. Tjänsten passar dig som är tekniskt kunnig, noggrann, serviceinriktad och trivs med att växla mellan praktiska och administrativa utmaningar. Du blir en viktig del av ett team som stödjer skolans dagliga drift – både digitalt och organisatoriskt.
  
  

**Vi erbjuder:**  

En nybyggd skola med välutrustade klassrum och moderna lärmiljöer
  
Tydlig organisation och starkt ledarskap
  
Ett arbetsklimat präglat av engagemang, respekt och delaktighet
  
Möjlighet till kompetensutveckling och karriärvägar inom skolan
  
  

Ange din löneanspråk i din ansökan.

title: Embedded Software Engineer Automotive
description:
Sweden Software Gothenburg Hybrid
We are now looking for an Embedded Software Engineer with expertise in C and C++ to strengthen our clients team developing real-time software for embedded systems.

  


About The Member Company
We are a global high-tech consultancy company with a team of entrepreneurial engineers, scientists, and digital experts from around the world. Together we form a fast-growing and proud community. We offer consultancy services to high-profile clients globally in diverse service areas, such as:


* Technology & Engineering
* Energy & Renewables
* Life sciences & Pharma
* Digital & IT
**About this vacancy**
----------------------


As an Embedded Software Engineer, you will develop and optimize software for control systems in our clients electrified vehicles and autonomous solutions. Your responsibilities will include:

* Designing, developing, and testing real-time embedded software in C and C++.
* Implementing algorithms and drivers for hardware-near systems.
* Optimizing performance and memory management for embedded platforms.
* Developing software in compliance with AUTOSAR, ISO 26262, and other safety standards.


**What we expect from you**
---------------------------


An Employneur that is a collaborative team player who believes in the power of positive influence. Embracing change, you continually seek innovative and improved approaches to tasks.


Experience within any below is desirable:

* At least five years of experience in embedded software development using C and C++.
* Experience with real-time operating systems and embedded Linux.
* Knowledge of model-based development (Matlab/Simulink) and testing.
* Fluent in Swedish and English, both written and spoken.
* Experience working in the Automotive industry in Sweden.


**What you can expect from us**
-------------------------------


In the role as an Employeneur, you will have the opportunity to both develop your technical skills and drive your own growth and business. We place great emphasis on your personal commitment and your willingness to advance your development. To support you with this, you will have the chance to influence the type of projects you take and the professional development you want to invest in. In other words, you are in control of your career.

  

Since TMC is an international company, we can offer projects in various locations across different countries where we and our clients operate. Currently, we are represented in Sweden, the Netherlands, Belgium, France, Luxembourg, Spain, Portugal, Italy, Hungary, the U.A.E., the USA, and Canada. The world is your workplace!


We’re currently on vacation, but we look forward to reviewing your application in August when we’re back.


#LI-LM4


The 5 basic principles of **employeneurship**
A long-term working relationship
Enjoy the security of a long-term contract and a stable source of income while getting the opportunity to work at diverse projects.


Individual profit sharing
Full transparency. That’s it. For each of your projects, you know your hourly rate, your costs, and your individual performance-based profit sharing, all in order to stimulate your inner entrepreneur.


Business cells
Our employeneurs are grouped in business cells based on their technical expertise. They are small, focused and function as high-grade knowledge networks. And as buzzing communities of close colleagues.


YOUniversity
Every employeneur drives their own career. Together, we make a plan for personal and professional growth. Receive personal coaching and an extensive training budget to keep developing yourself and deliver outperformance at our clients.

  

The Entrepreneurial Lab
Work on your technical dreams in our lab. Collaborate with others in multidisciplinary teams to unlock out-of-the-box thinking and innovative ideas as well as entrepreneurial skills.
company_description: At TMC we believe it's people who drive technology. Our Employeneurship model creates the best conditions for technical talents to do so.

title: Automationsingenjör/PLC-programmerare
description:
Sweden Manufacturing Support Skövde On-site
Vårt kontor i Skövde befinner sig i en spännande tillväxtfas, och vi söker nu fler medarbetare till vårt team inom Operational Excellence!

  


About The Member Company
We are a global high-tech consultancy company with a team of entrepreneurial engineers, scientists, and digital experts from around the world. Together we form a fast-growing and proud community. We offer consultancy services to high-profile clients globally in diverse service areas, such as:


* Technology & Engineering
* Energy & Renewables
* Life sciences & Pharma
* Digital & IT
**About this vacancy**
----------------------


Är du utbildad Automationsingenjör/PLC-programmerare med minst 5 års erfarnenhet och söker en spännande möjlighet? På TMC söker vi passionerade och engagerade ingenjörer med stark entusiasm för att optimera och automatisera robotar, produktionslinor och fabriker.


I denna roll får du en central position i att skapa och anpassa PLC-program för att styra produktionsutrustning och system. Du ansvarar för att samordna och implementera lösningar för kontinuerlig integration och leverans. Du kommer att arbeta med att optimera, underhålla, felsöka samt säkerställa hög tillgänglighet och prestanda för våra kunders system. Ditt ansvar inkluderar även att stödja utvecklingsteam med verktyg och processer som förbättrar effektiviteten och kvaliteten i kundens automationslösningar.


Du kommer att arbeta i en dynamisk miljö med nära samarbete mellan olika team, vilket ger dig möjlighet att utveckla både tekniska och kommunikativa färdigheter.


**What we expect from you**
---------------------------


Vi söker dig som är utbildad ingenjör inom automation, mekatronik, produktionsteknik eller liknande område och har arbetat med PLC och robotprogrammering. Du har ett brinnande intresse för automatisering och drivs av att effektivisera och förbättra processer och system.


För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du:

* Har erfarenhet av programmering av industrirobotar, särskilt Fanuc och ABB (RAPID).
* Har arbetat med design och implementering av PLC- och SCADA-system, främst Siemens TIA Portal.
* Talar och skriver flytande på både svenska och engelska.
* Är självgående, nyfiken och lösningsorienterad.


Meriterande erfarenhet:* Kunskap om maskinsäkerhet och tillämpning av relevanta standarder.
* Erfarenhet av visionsystem.
* Bakgrund inom tillverkningsindustrin

-------------------------------


I rollen som Employeneur får du både utveckla dina tekniska kunskaper och driva din egen utveckling och affär. Du blir del av en innovativ och entreprenöriell organisation där fokuset ligger på ständig utveckling och möjligheten att vara fullt ansvarig för att styra din egen karriär.

  

Vi lägger stor vikt vid ditt personliga engagemang och din vilja att driva din utveckling framåt. För att lyckas med det ges du chansen att själv påverka vilken typ av projekt du tar dig an samt vilken kompetensutveckling du vill investera i. Du styr din karriär helt enkelt.

  

Eftersom TMC är ett internationellt företag kan vi erbjuda projekt på olika platser i olika länder där vi och våra kunder finns. För närvarande finns vi representerade i Sverige, Nederländerna, Belgien, Frankrike, Luxemburg, Spanien, Portugal, Italien, Ungern, U.A.E., USA och Kanada. Du får världen som arbetsplats!

Due to vacation, we will handle your application in August.
